oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gaylord Union leather pistol box
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Union leather pistol box is stamped by manufacturer E. Gaylord from Chicopee Massachusetts. Between 1862 and 1865, Gaylord had a contract to make 5,000 pistol cartridge boxes. The purpose of the pistol cartridge box is to hold the paper cartridges for the revolvers of the time period.
